definition: to express a different view/to take a different position
to sing/to call loudly/to chant
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: If no overcapacity, it is clear that it is disgreeing with MIIT.
sentences.chinese: 如果说产能不过剩，摆明了是跟工信部唱反调。

sentences.english: Do not neglect this on your site.
sentences.chinese: 别在你的网站上唱反调。

sentences.english: Accept constructive criticism, but ignore naysayers.
sentences.chinese: 接受建设性的批评，但是忽略那些老唱反调的人。

sentences.english: We dare not oppose the central government.
sentences.chinese: 我们哪敢跟中央政府唱反调。

sentences.english: Now, start playing Devil's Advocate and challenge yourself to find the positive.
sentences.chinese: 现在开始喜欢唱反调以及挑战自己寻找积极面。

sentences.english: Less trust and more cantankerousness might not necessarily be a bad thing, however, Hamann and his group wrote.
sentences.chinese: 然而，将信将疑，爱唱反调也并不一定是件坏事。

sentences.english: what was he trying to un-throne, dethrone in Aristotle?
sentences.chinese: 他在那些方面和亚里士多德唱反调呢？

sentences.english: I've faced lots of naysayers every step of the way.
sentences.chinese: 在我走的每一步当中我已经遇到很多唱反调的。

sentences.english: No matter what I do , he always kick aganist.
sentences.chinese: 不论我做什么，他总是要和我唱反调。

sentences.english: Joe often gets into fights because he is always looking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 跟人家唱反调，你是在自找争吵。

definition: to adopt confrontational posture/to meet head-on/to compete
to put on a rival show (idiom); to set oneself up against sb/to get into confrontation
to set oneself against/to oppose/to make a pair
to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
to fail to meet each other/to conflict with each other/to be at odds with
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom)/willful/one's own way/dogmatic
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
erhua variant of 較勁|较劲[jiao4 jin4]
to play dumb/to slack off (idiom)
to bare one shoulder/(fig.) to side with/to discriminate in favor of
to persist in one's views
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
to try to smooth things over/to paper over the issues/to gloss things over
to contradict (elders or superiors)
